Po.Action: Lands hard on the floor and tries to clear his head after waking up late.
Attempts to imitate Kung Fu heroes enthusiastically despite clumsiness.
Tries to play it cool when noticed by a neighbor (the pig) but then quickly ducks out of sight.
Apologizes to his dad after falling down.
Attempts to kick himself to his feet but struggles due to his belly.
Hops to his feet and imitates Kung Fu action figures, showing enthusiasm but not serious skill.
Tries to play it cool when noticed by a neighbor but quickly ducks out of sight, indicating some social awkwardness.
Throws ninja stars at the wall twice and fails to hit the mark.
Trips and falls going downstairs and then falls flat on his face in the kitchen.
Gets to work despite kitchen not being suited for his size, showing willingness to engage in tasks.
Hands a noodle bowl to a customer, makes a playful joke about the soup being sharp.
Hides his dream and seems reluctant to admit it.
Asks his dad if he ever wanted to do something else besides noodles, showing curiosity and openness.
Hides his throwing star behind his back, tries to avoid admitting his real dream.
Accidentally serves a throwing star in a bowl of noodles, shows lack of attention or clumsiness.
Responds quickly to warn customer about the throwing star in soup.
Nervously questions the meaning of the 'sign' and the expectations placed on him.
Responds to his dad's wistful story with curiosity and engagement, asking 'So why didn't you?!'
Accepts his dad's playful teasing about his place at the tables 'two, five, seven, and twelve' without negativity.
Responds quickly and confidently to his dad's comment about place in the world, showing self-awareness.
Says 'Oop...sorry.' after almost hitting customers while serving.
Tells angry patron 'Sorry. Suck it up.'
Apologizes immediately after disturbing a bunny family's meal (Oop! Sorry! A thousand pardons.)
Urgently encourages all villagers to go to the Jade Palace and not worry about paying for their meals, telling them to just take their bowls.
Pauses and loses his nerve when talking to his dad, showing hesitation and deference.
Rushes up to the poster quickly upon noticing the gong and poster; encourages others to hurry to the Jade Palace.
Apologizes promptly after accidentally disturbing a family while trying to get their attention.
Forgets his noodle cart in his eagerness to get to the event, then hesitates and loses nerve when talking to his dad.
Attempts to justify a practical idea (selling bean buns) but lacks confidence to fully assert it.
Presses forward struggling to carry his noodle cart up the long stairs despite the heat and difficulty.
Responds to the pigs passing by with a determined statement to bring back a souvenir himself, showing motivation but no hostility or resentment.
Struggles to pull his noodle cart up a long flight of stairs but persists despite the difficulty and sun beating down on him.
Though exhausted and having only advanced seven steps, he refuses to give up and decides to bring back a souvenir himself, indicating determination and confidence.
Laughs victoriously after climbing the steps, showing enthusiasm and excitement.
Pounds on the arena door and yells to be let in, demonstrating eagerness and earnestness.
Panic momentarily after being locked out, then quickly tries to find another way to see the tournament, showing determination and sincere interest.
Cheers for the Furious Five and their moves, showing friendly support and admiration.
Tells a spectator to get out of the way abruptly.
Sits alone atop the stairs after repeated failures.
Backs up to get a better look but accidentally falls down the stairs.
Tries karate chopping the door open but fails and slumps to the ground.
Attempts a pole vault but falls and gets hit by the pole.
Rigs a catapult but gets clobbered by it, crowd cheers.
Pulls on a rope tied to a tree with attention and enthusiasm.
Launches himself over the fence to get a peek at Tigress, showing initiative despite falling out of view.
Sees fireworks and quickly has an idea, indicating alertness and quick thinking.
Lies to his dad about dreaming of noodles, then takes a daring and playful risk with fireworks to see the Dragon Warrior.
Despite embarrassment and danger, accepts his father's support and agrees to get back to work.
Apologizes awkwardly and tries to shuffle away after realizing he accidentally disrupted the ceremony.
Shows embarrassment and humility after being unexpectedly chosen as the Dragon Warrior.
Does not respond arrogantly or aggressively to the surprising honor, instead appears stunned and unsure.
Falls into the center of the ring unexpectedly and is confused about being chosen.
Tries to apologize and move out of the way when chosen as the Dragon Warrior.
Is visibly embarrassed and stunned by being selected but does not resist or react negatively.
Collapses the palanquin carrying him due to his weight, unintentionally causing a scene.
Po is ushered in with great honor, seemingly accepted as the Dragon Warrior, but he is confused and uncertain about his new role.
Po tries to speak up and clarify that there might be a mistake, showing awareness and willingness to address confusion.
Po reacts in surprise and amazement at the Sacred Hall of Warriors, showing enthusiasm but not yet demonstrating skill or confidence.
Admiring ancient kung fu artifacts with enthusiasm and awe, calling out playfully to the Urn of Whispering Warriors
Apologizes to the vase for not coming to see Master Shifu first, shows awareness of others' expectations
Casually jokes about Shifu not going anywhere, tries to keep tone light despite tension
Accidentally breaks the vase but immediately offers to fix it and asks for help
Carefully approaches the Sword of Heroes, making sure not to touch it.
Runs around the room amazed by the artifacts, indicating curiosity and engagement.
Calls into the legendary Urn of Whispering Warriors, showing playful naivety.
Turns around immediately when Shifu asks, showing willingness to listen.
Bumps the vase and breaks it while distracted.
Attempts to fix the vase and asks for glue, showing problem-solving and responsibility.
Responds to Shifu's criticism with light-hearted, playful remarks and points out when Shifu is unkind.
Shows vulnerability and uncertainty about being the Dragon Warrior, answering hesitantly.
Allows Shifu to hit and swat him without retaliation, showing tolerance and good-naturedness despite harsh treatment.
Attempts to correct Shifu politely when insulted unfairly, demonstrating sincerity and assertiveness without hostility.
Responds uncertainly when asked if he is the Dragon Warrior, showing lack of confidence and understanding.
Asks naively how to reach the Dragon Scroll, indicating a lack of knowledge and seriousness.
Attempts to defend himself lightly when Shifu mocks his physical form, showing some self-awareness but not seriousness.
Perseveres through Shifu's harsh criticism without giving up immediately.
Nervously engages with Shifu's training and acknowledges his lack of confidence but remains sincere.
Expresses fear and hesitation about training but does not give up immediately.
Half-heartedly follows Shifu, showing reluctance and lack of full commitment.
Recalls and explains the Wuxi Finger Hold correctly when prompted by Shifu.
Nervously reacts to Shifu's grip on his finger and seems overwhelmed by training environment and advanced kung fu moves.
Expresses doubt about his ability to perform complex kung fu moves when confronted with the gauntlet.
Agrees clearly and promptly to Shifu's warning and instructions despite inner nervousness.
Acknowledges his beginner level honestly and seeks a manageable starting point.
Shows friendly, playful banter with the Furious Five, complimenting them and engaging sincerely.
Is hesitant about performing kung fu in front of others, showing modesty and some insecurity.
Persistently tries the obstacle course despite repeated failures and pain, asking Shifu how he did at the end.
Listens to others mock him and quietly observes without confrontation.
Tries to look at his toes, struggles physically but makes a humorous attempt and doesn't lash out.
Accidentally stumbles noisily into the bunkhouse but attempts friendly small talk with Crane.
Does not respond negatively to Crane's cold dismissal and actually tries to make conversation.
Attempts to look at his toes but falls over due to his physical condition.
Sighs and watches others go inside, showing quiet acceptance but no immediate action.
Tip-toes into the hall carefully but causes noise and falls when the floor breaks under him, rolling his ankle and stumbling.
Tries to casually engage Crane in conversation despite awkwardness, showing social confidence.
Expresses admiration and respect for Crane, calling him 'awesome' and praising his bravery.
Accidentally damages Crane's room but quickly apologizes.
Does not react negatively or with anger when Crane tells him he doesn't belong in the room; instead, he accepts the rebuke and tries to leave politely.
Insists on continuing to engage with Crane despite being told to leave, reopening the door and smiling eagerly.
Does a spastic series of Kung Fu moves, accidentally kicks through a paper wall, apologizes awkwardly.
Tries to politely exit after being told he doesn't belong in Crane's room, but then reenters immediately with an eager smile.
Attempts to keep conversation light and positive despite embarrassment, showing social adaptability.
Responds politely and somewhat humbly to Tigress despite harsh rejection.
Admits to feeling upset and acknowledges his shortcomings honestly to Oogway.
Expresses self-doubt and a desire to quit, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Slumps sadly after being rejected by Tigress.
Acknowledges his poor performance honestly to Oogway.
Considers quitting and returning to noodle-making, expressing self-doubt.
Greets Master Shifu and attempts to warm up despite previous quitting, showing friendliness and effort.
Relies on Crane for help and thanks him sincerely.
Leaves the bunkhouse early, apparently quits training, avoiding confrontation.
Returns early to training hall to warm up despite previous quitting, attempts self-motivation.
Gets physically stuck while stretching/warming up, requires assistance.
Collects a piece of broken board as a souvenir despite Shifu's disapproval.
Laughs excitedly and salutes Shifu after being scolded.
Responds positively to getting beaten in sparring by Viper, saying 'That was awesome!' and wants to spar again.
Maintains a respectful salute to Shifu even after repeated physical failures and being beaten.
Tries to learn a full split in one night, showing impatience and misunderstanding of skill development.
Keeps a broken board piece as a souvenir despite Shifu's warning, showing lack of discipline.
Responds positively and enthusiastically to getting knocked down, eager to continue training despite repeated failures.
Fails repeatedly in sparring sessions, getting beaten by various opponents including Viper, Monkey, Crane, and Mantis.
Maintains a positive attitude and salutes Shifu even when falling flat on his back, demonstrating resilience and respect.
Expresses excitement and eagerness to face Shifu in training.
Shows sincere determination and respect by promising to never quit and reassuring Master.
Endures physical hardship (falls, acupuncture needles) with a humorous and good-natured attitude.
Makes light of his pain and endures acupuncture despite discomfort, showing resilience and a good-natured attitude.
Jokes about Mantis' comment on his size, demonstrating self-awareness and good humor rather than insecurity.
Fails to immediately grasp the seriousness behind Master Shifu's tough methods, indicating some initial naivety.
Tries to ease the tension by confidently speaking about Tai Lung's background.
Shows nervousness and trails off when explaining details about Tai Lung and Kung Fu.
Demonstrates ignorance about key facts regarding Tai Lung, prompting Tigress to correct him.
Makes a googly-eyed face and treats training like a joke.
Falls face first with needles in his back during training.
Is doubted by Shifu who says Po is not the Dragon Warrior and was an accident.
Cooks for the Five, serves them soup, is bashful when complimented, tries to include Tigress by having Monkey encourage her to try the food.
Makes fun of himself and imitates Shifu playfully to make the others laugh.
Laughs along with the others when they notice the noodle moustache.
Reacts normally and non-defensively when Shifu enters, showing respect.
Embarrasses himself playfully in front of Shifu, showing a lighthearted and friendly nature.
Laughs nervously or in disbelief at the serious threat of Tai Lung, indicating possible avoidance or lack of seriousness.
Runs away from the compound rather than facing a serious situation directly.
Embarrasses himself by placing soup bowls on his chest like a bra and slurping noodles humorously despite the serious situation.
Laughs nervously and initially denies the seriousness of the threat, showing disbelief and avoidance.
Runs away from the compound after being identified as the Dragon Warrior and the only hope against Tai Lung.
Stays despite adversity and verbal abuse from Shifu because he hopes Shifu can change him and believes in his potential.
Denies Shifu's role as his master and refuses to accept being the Dragon Warrior.
Attempts to run away from the compound instead of confronting the challenge.
Tries to maneuver around Shifu to escape, showing some agility but ultimately fails.
Expresses doubt over his ability to beat Tai Lung and Shifu, showing lack of confidence.
Acknowledges he didn’t quit despite adversity and mistreatment, demonstrating perseverance.
Openly admits his insecurities and feelings, showing self-awareness but also doubt.
Resists Shifu’s authority and pushes the staff away, showing defiance but not skillful handling.
Shows emotional growth by explaining why he stayed and expressing a desire to be changed for the better.
Stops eating immediately and makes eye contact with Shifu upon being noticed, shows respect and attentiveness.
Indicates confidence or defiance with the line 'That's what I thought' after Shifu admits ignorance.
Performs some amazing Kung Fu in the kitchen, demonstrating unexpected skill.
Stops mid-munch when caught by Shifu, showing some lack of discipline or focus.
Successfully climbs and maintains a perfect split ten feet off the ground, albeit by accident.
Eats cookies in secret and is caught by Shifu, showing a lack of discretion.
Admits ignorance about how he got up on the shelf and calls it an accident rather than recognizing skill.
Slips and falls from the shelves, demonstrating poor control over his movements.
Speaks sarcastically and questions Shifu's intentions, indicating skepticism but also engagement.
Expresses awe and reverence about the Pool of Sacred Tears and the birthplace of Kung Fu.
Tears of joy well up in his eyes when Shifu accepts to be his master.
Sniffs back tears and smiles, showing emotional sincerity and vulnerability.
Complains jokingly about being hungry during training with dumplings, showing a friendly, light-hearted attitude.
Winded and wheezing, slowly works his way up the hill, but persists.
Stops quickly and realizes when Shifu corrects him about washing in the Pool of Sacred Tears.
Shows awe and eagerness to learn Kung Fu when asked by Shifu.
Tears up with joy at being accepted as Shifu's student, showing emotional openness.
Scowls when Shifu says he stinks as a beginner, showing frustration but no overt quitting.
Responds with a light joke about being hungry when Shifu offers dumplings to motivate training.
Engages in playful sparring with Shifu over the dumplings, showing spirited interaction.
Tosses the final dumpling back to Shifu, refusing to eat himself.
Is not directly involved in the fight or rescue efforts on the bridge; others take the lead in combat and strategy.
Though mentioned by Tai Lung as a warrior unlike anything the world has seen, Po's actual behavior in this excerpt shows no direct demonstration of skill or confident action.
Has an easy spring in his step and confidently tells Shifu, 'Done well? Done well?! I've done awesome!'
Swings his belly around and knocks Shifu off balance, showing playful confidence and physical capability.
Quickly assesses the condition of his friends, noting that they are breathing and have their eyes open.
Admits feeling scared in response to the threat, showing vulnerability but also honesty.
Expresses doubt about his ability to defeat Tai Lung, emphasizing his limitations compared to the Five Masters.
Expresses excitement and eagerness about reading the Dragon Scroll and his potential abilities, responds sincerely to Shifu's encouragement.
Distracted and unfocused when told to focus by Shifu.
Passes the tube to Shifu after struggling to open it and thanks him sincerely.
Shares the blank scroll with Shifu and shows his disappointment openly.
Makes a self-deprecating joke about Oogway picking him by accident and doubts himself.
Struggles to open the scroll and fails without help, tries to bite it off.
Expresses uncertainty and doubt about his role as Dragon Warrior after seeing the blank scroll.
Attempts to open the scroll in front of the Five and Shifu, showing willingness to take initiative despite difficulty.
Po resists being pulled away but ultimately lets the Five lead him off, showing emotional control in a difficult moment.
Po is left by himself and proceeds through the bustling town to see his dad, demonstrating initiative and calmness amid chaos.
Po reacts with heartbreak to Shifu's sacrifice and the unfolding crisis, showing emotional vulnerability but little action at this moment.
Bends down to reciprocate his dad's hug.
Responds listlessly to his dad's greeting and does not follow him immediately.
Slumps against the cart showing emotional vulnerability.
Says 'sometimes I can't believe I'm actually your son,' expressing doubt and emotional conflict.
Feigns excitement about the secret ingredient to not disappoint his dad.
Po listlessly responds to his dad, slumps against the cart, and feigns excitement but shows little real engagement or confidence.
Po questions his father's secret ingredient but fails to show genuine interest or skill-related insight.
Po listens quietly to his father without taking initiative or displaying confidence in his future.
Picks up the Scroll and understands there is no secret ingredient, smiles serenely showing realization and confidence.
Interrupts a tense moment to confront Tai Lung and defend Shifu despite fear.
Uses humor ('Don't tempt me. Haha.') to face an intimidating opponent.
Engages in physical combat with Tai Lung to protect the Dragon Scroll and allies.
Interrupts the confrontation bravely and claims to be the Dragon Warrior despite obvious physical disadvantage.
Out of breath and visibly struggling (says 'Stairs...'), indicating some physical unpreparedness.
Attempts a confident bluff and uses the Dragon Scroll to challenge Tai Lung.
Gets punched across the room and loses possession of the Dragon Scroll quickly.
Recovers quickly by bouncing off a pillar and physically striking Tai Lung, showing resilience and skillful fighting.
After attacking, he strikes a pose confidently but then immediately turns to run when Tai Lung charges.
Clings to the scroll despite physical danger, uses creative tactics to outwit Tai Lung, protects the scroll.
Reassures Tai Lung by saying 'It's okay. I didn't get it the first time either.'
Laughs and giggles during Tai Lung's attack, trying to lighten the mood with humor.
Uses unorthodox fighting techniques that include playful moves like a butt bump against Tai Lung.
Uses playful humor and light-hearted taunt ('I'm not a big, fat panda. I'm the big, fat panda.') toward Tai Lung during battle.
Demonstrates respect and affection by thanking and hugging his dad after the battle.
Rushes to Shifu's side breathless, anxiously asks if he is okay.
Expresses relief and pride in defeating Tai Lung to reassure Shifu.
Pleading desperately for Shifu not to die, showing sincere attachment and concern.
Respectfully nods as Shifu instructs him to stop talking, showing deference and patience.
Fidgets and nearly breaks silence next to a peacefully resting Shifu, indicating struggle to contain emotion but ultimately restraining himself.
Defeats Tai Lung, bringing peace to the Valley.
Races breathlessly, worriedly, to Shifu's side and shows concern.
Freaks out and pleads for Shifu not to die, unable to remain calm.
Stops himself from speaking further, showing self-control and reverence.
Invites Shifu to get something to eat.
